tuv.seg: Students on campus - crime prevention
Comhairle Sábháilteachta do mhic léinn ar láthair an choláiste
Taking the following precautions should help you avoid becoming a victim of crime while you are on campus in Ireland
Má bhíonn tú ar d'fhaichill ar na rudaí seo a leanas ba cheart go mbeadh sé ina chúnamh duit teacht slán ó choireanna agus tú ar láthair an choláiste
• Make sure your apartment and house doors are locked at all times
• Bí cinnte go bhfuil glas ar na doirse san arasán agus sa teach an t-am ar fad
When leaving your apartment, you should check to make that all windows are locked
Nuair a fhágann tú d'arasán, ba cheart duit déanamh cinnte go bhfuil na fuinneoga ar fad faoi ghlas
• Never give your apartment keys to anyone else and never leave your keys where others could have access to them
• Ná tabhair eochracha an arasáin d'aon duine eile ariamh agus ná fág ariamh do chuid eochracha in áit gur féidir le daoine eile teacht orthu
• Before you admit any callers to your apartment, make sure that you are satisfied with their identity - ask for identification if in doubt
• Roimh duit aon duine a thagann chuig an doras a ligean isteach san arasán, bí cinnte go bhfuil tú sásta cé atá ann, má tá tú in amhras iarr ar an duine fianaise aitheantais a chur ar fáil duit
• Tell a trusted neighbour if you are going away
• Inis do chomharsa gur féidir leat muinín a bheith agat as/aisti má bhíonn tú ag dul ar saoire
• Make sure that you do not have obvious signs of a vacant apartment - for example, curtains drawn during daylight hours
• Déan cinnte nach bhfuil sé soiléir nach bhfuil aon duine ag baile san arasán – e.g., na cuirtíní a bheith dúnta i rith an lae
• Make sure that all your property is marked with your own personal identification code
• Bí cinnte cód aitheantais phearsanta a chur ar do chuid maoine ar fad
You should securely lock away items of value
Ba cheart aon rudaí luachmhara a chur faoi ghlas
• When travelling on foot, use busy routes and well-lit walkways - avoid isolated and dark areas
• Nuair atá tú ag siúl bain úsáid as na bóithre gnóthacha agus cosáin le neart soilse – fan amach as áiteanna iargúlta agus dorcha
• Tell another trusted individual of your intended destination, mode of transport and expected arrival time
• Inis do dhuine eile a bhfuil muinín agat as/aisti cá bhfuil tú ag dul, cén módh taistil atá agat agus cén t-am go bhfuil tú ag súil a bheith ann
• Walk facing the traffic so that vehicles cannot approach you from behind without you being aware of their presence
• Siúl agus an trácht ag teacht i do threo sa chaoi nach mbeidh feithiclí in ann tiomáint suas ar do chúla i ngan fhios duit
• Avoid displaying obvious valuables on your person, for example, jewellery, handbags, unless completely necessary
• Seachain rudaí luchmhara a bheith le feiceáil ort, mar shampla seodra, málaí láimhe, ach amháin sa chás nach bhfuil an dara rogha agat
• Carry only the amount of cash that you require - credit cards and bank pass books should be kept securely out of sight and not in your hip pockets

• Ná bíodh ach an méid airgid thirim a theastaíonn uait dhá iompar agat – ba cheart cártaí creidmheasa agus leabhair phas baince a choinneáil go sábhailte in áit nach féidir iad a fheiceáil agus ná coinnigh i bpócaí do chromáin iad
• If you think you are being followed, go to the nearest place where there are people, even a private residence, and ring the Gardai
• Má cheapann tú go bhfuil duine do do leanúint téigh chuig an áit is giorra duit ina bhfuil daoine, fiú más teach príobháideach atá ann, agus cuir glaoch ar na Gardaí
• If you have been assaulted, help is available to you 24 hours a day
• Má déanadh ionsaí ort tá cúnamh ar fáil duit 24 uair sa lá

In any case involving sexual assault, you may feel dirty, but you should not wash, change your clothes or clean up the immediate vicinity until after you have talked to the Gardai as you may unwittingly destroy essential evidence

Nuair atá ionsaí gnéis i gceist d'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh tú ag mothú salach, ach ní cheart duit tú féin a níochán, ná do chuid éadaí a níochán ná an láthair a ghlanadh go dtí go bhfuil tú tar éis labhairt leis na Gardaí mar d'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh fianaise riachtanach millte agat i ngan fhios duit
• Avoid situations that will require you to travel alone at night-time
• Fan glan ó thaisteal leat féin san oíche
If, however, you must travel on your own, plan your journey to limit your exposure to risk of assault, robbery or theft, by scheduling your journey to coincide with bus and train times
Más gá duit, áfach, taisteal leat féin, déan an turas a phleanáil timpeall ar amanna bus agus traenacha sa chaoi go mbeidh aon phriacal a bhaineann le hionsaí nó goid laghdaithe
You should use a taxi if no other transport is available
Ba cheart duit úsáid a bhaint as tacsaí muna bhfuil aon mhódh taistil eile ar fáil duit
• Do not leave valuables in your vehicle. If, however, this is necessary, secure them out of sight in the boot of the vehicle
• Ná fág rudaí luachmhara i d'fheithicil, más gá duit é seo a dhéanamh, áfach, cuir amach as radharc iad i gcófra bagáiste na feithicle
• Never leave personal documents, for example, driving licences and insurance certificates, in your vehicle
• Ná fág ariamh cáipéisí pearsanta mar shampla, ceadúnais tiomána agus teastais árachais, i d'fheithicil
• Consider having the registration number etched onto the windows of the vehicle and on valuable car components
• Smaoinigh ar uimhir chláraithe an chairr a eitseáil ar fhuinneoga na feithicle agus ar píosaí luachmhara eile den charr
• When parking your vehicle, avoid isolated or darkened areas
• Nuair atá tú ag páirceáil do chairr, fan amach as áiteanna iargúlta agus dorcha
Use a well-lit street or thoroughfare at night-time
Bain úsáid as sráid le neart soilse nó áit phoiblí san oíche
• Consider fitting a good quality car alarm and/or immobiliser in your vehicle
• Smaoinigh ar aláram d'ardchaighdeán a chur sa charr agus/nó gléas doghluaiseachta
A hardened steel chain and close shackle padlock fitted to the steering wheel is a visible and effective deterrent to thieves
Má bhíonn slabhra cruach agus glas fraincín le dlúthlúbanna ar an roth stiúrtha is cosc feiceálach agus éifeachtach é do ghadaithe
• Never pick up hitchhikers
• Ná pioc suas síobshiúlóirí ag aon am
Security for your bicycle
Slándáil do do rothar
• When you buy a bicycle, you should insist on obtaining a receipt showing the name and address of the seller/trader, together with the make, model, colour and frame number of your machine
• Nuair a cheannaíonn tú rothar ba cheart duit déanamh cinnte go bhfaigheann tú admháil le ainm agus seoladh an díoltóra/trádálaí air, chomh maith le déanamh, cineál, dath agus uimhir fhráma d'innill
You should retain this receipt for future reference
Ba cheart duit an admháil seo a choinneáil mar phointe tagartha don todhchaí
• Secure your bicycle when unattended by using a good quality-locking device
• Fáisc do rothar nuair atá sé gan tionlacan tríd úsáid a bhaint as glas d'ardchaighdeán
• Leave your bicycle in a supervised area or an area where it can be seen by passers-by
• Fág do rothar in áit atá faoi mhaoirseacht nó in áit gur féidir le daoine atá ag dul thart é a fheiceáil
• Take a photograph of your bicycle and engrave your own personal identifying number on the frame
• Tóg griangraf den rothar agus déan d'uimhir phearsanta aitheantais a eitseáil ar an bhfráma
You can find a leaflet entitled Stay Safe on Campus on the the Garda Síochána website
Is féidir leat teacht ar bileog dar teideal Bí Sábháilte ar an gCampas ar an láithreán gréasáin an Gharda Síochána
There are a number of support services available to victims of crime
Tá seirbhísí tacaíochta ar fáil don íobartach
If you have been a victim of a crime, you should report the incident to your nearest Garda station immediately
Má tá tú gur íospartach coire, ba chóir duit an teagmhas do stáisiún Garda is gaire láithreach
Contact information for every Garda station in Ireland is available at the front of all public telephone directories
Tá eolas teagmhála do gach stáisiún na nGardaí in Éirinn ar fáil ag tosach an eolaí teileafóin poiblí
